msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County Greeting: Dr. J.W. Waughop manager of the Insane Asylum

We command you, that you have the body of James A. Balch by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said James A. Balch shall be called or charged, before the Roger S. Greene Richard A. Jones, Judge of the aforesaid Court at the Court House in the City of Seattle W.T. on June 5th A.D. 1888 at the hour of 1:30 o'clock P.M. to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said James A. Balch And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. Roger S. GreeneRichard A. Jones, Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 1st day of June A.D. 1888
W.E. Ledgerwood, JAMES SEAVEY Clerk. By H. T. Hannon Deputy
Office of the Sheriff of Pierce County W.T.

I J.H. Wilt Sheriff of Pierce County Washington Territory do hereby certify that on the 2nd day of June A.D. 1888 I served the original Writ of Habeas Corpus of which the within is a true copy on J.W. Waughop the person therein named by delivering said original Writ of Habeas Corpus to the said J.W. Waughop at Fort Steilacoom in said Pierce County, W.T.
Dated at Tacoma W.T. June 2nd, 1888 J.H. Wilt Sheriff of Pierce Co. Wash Ter
Sheriffs Fees To Copy of Writ .60 Serving Original 1.00 Mileage 24 miles 2.40 $4.00
